Research Areas

Our work spans multiple areas in wireless systems, next generation transport protoccol, adaptive video streaming, and sensing.

Improve application QoE under intermittent / poor Internet connectivity

Techniques to improve application-level Quality-of-Experience (video streaming) when networks are lossy, intermittent, bandwidth-limited and over high speed Internet.

Related projects
  • Live video streaming utilizing multipath
    MMSys 2025 (2025)
  • Optimizing HTTP/3 for poor networks
    TNSM 2024 (2024)
  • Dataset of HTTP/3 based streaming under poor network
    NeurIPS 2023 (dataset) (2023)
  • Send data over WiFi management frames for challenging networks
    MASS 2020 (2020)
  • ISAC: Integrated Sensing and Communication
    IMWUT 2025 (2025)
Dense WiFi Challenges

Measurement and solutions for problems arising in dense WiFi deployments: RRM, scanning, AP health, and classroom performance.

Related projects
  • Send data over WiFi management frames for challenging networks
    MASS 2020 (2020)
  • Performance of Dense WiFi in Classroom
    COMSNETS 2015 / TMC 2016 (2015)
  • Diagnose health of WiFi networks
    TMC 2017 (2017)
  • RRM to improve WiFi performance in dense deployments
    PIMRC 2020 / ICC 2022 / MobiWac 2022 (2020)
  • Causes of active scanning in dense WiFi
    WoWMoM 2019 (2019)
  • WiFi sensing for dense deployments
    Workshop / Demo (2021)
WiFi Sensing

Using commodity WiFi signals for sensing tasks such as engagement detection, activity recognition and environment monitoring.

Related projects
  • ISAC: Integrated Sensing and Communication
    IMWUT 2025 (2025)
  • WiFi sensing to detect engagement in online classes
    ICMI 2023 (2023)
  • WiFi sensing for dense deployments
    Workshop / Demo (2021)

@2025 WiNSys Lab at the IIT Madras
